title: Lamamra receives Arab counterparts in Beirut
text: The Minister of Foreign Affairs and National Community Abroad, Ramtane Lamamra held talks in Beirut (Lebanon) on the eve of the Consultative Meeting of the Arab Ministers of Foreign Affairs with his counterparts from two brotherly countries, namely the State of Kuwait and the Republic of Tunisia.

The meetings focused on the brotherly and cooperation ties between Algeria and these two sisterly countries, and the ways to strengthen consultation and coordination on the developments on the regional scene, in the light of the challenges resulting from international tensions.

The two ministers emphasized the importance of the upcoming Algiers Summit in promoting the Arab joint action and the values of solidarity and cooperation. They congratulated Algeria, people and Government, on the 60th anniversary of Independence.

According to the same source, Lamamra met with some of his counterparts and the Secretary-General of the Arab League, Ahmed Aboul Gheit, on the sidelines of the dinner organized by Lebanonâ€™s PM, Najib Mikati, in honor of the leaders of the delegations attending this consultative meeting.
